heisigStory: Rice field . . . half. The key word here refers to the ridges that rise up between the sections of a rice paddy.
koohiiStory1: A PADDY-RIDGE divides the RICE FIELD in HALF.
koohiiStory2: Think about a large rice field as a big square. Then you draw a line down the middle, halving it into two. Then you draw a line across the middle, halving it again into four... These halvings are paddy-ridges that separate the rice field into separate sections. I dunno the reason why, but that´s how it´s done.
